properties.name: conductor.db.type
properties.description: The type of database to be used while running the Conductor application.

properties.name: conductor.indexing.enabled
properties.description: Enable indexing to elasticsearch/opensearch. If set to false, a no-op implementation will be used.

properties.name: conductor.indexing.type
properties.description: The type of indexing backend to use. Supported values: elasticsearch, opensearch, postgres, sqlite.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.url
properties.description: The comma separated list of urls for the OpenSearch cluster. Format: host1:port1,host2:port2

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.version
properties.description: The OpenSearch version (1, 2, etc.) for version-specific API handling.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.indexPrefix
properties.description: The index prefix to be used when creating indices in OpenSearch.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.clusterHealthColor
properties.description: The color of the OpenSearch cluster health to wait for.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.indexShardCount
properties.description: The number of shards that the OpenSearch index will be created with.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.indexReplicasCount
properties.description: The number of replicas that the OpenSearch index will be configured to have.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.autoIndexManagementEnabled
properties.description: Whether automatic index management is enabled for OpenSearch.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.taskLogResultLimit
properties.description: The number of task log results that will be returned in the response.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.asyncMaxPoolSize
properties.description: The maximum number of threads allowed in the async pool for OpenSearch operations.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.asyncWorkerQueueSize
properties.description: The size of the queue used for holding async OpenSearch indexing tasks.

properties.name: conductor.opensearch.indexBatchSize
properties.description: The size of the batch to be used for bulk indexing in async mode.
